Curriculum Vitae

Work Experience

  • Research Assistant, Victoria University of Wellington (2025–current)
    Marsden-funded project "Uncovering the functioning and importance of temperate mesophotic ecosystems" with Dr. Alice Rogers and Dr. James Bell; ecosystem modelling and conservation planning.
  • Postdoctoral Scholar, Integrated Marine Fisheries Lab, Oregon State University (current)
    Research on ecosystem modeling and climate science for NOAA’s ACLIM and GOACLIM projects.

Education

  • Ph.D. Marine Biology, Victoria University of Wellington, NZ (2018–2024)
    Modelling Coral Reef Futures: Exploring the role of structural complexity in sustaining ecosystem services
  • BSc Hons Marine Science & Applied Mathematics, Coastal Carolina University, USA (2010–2014)
    Summa cum Laude. Dual degrees with honours.

Work History

  • Research Assistant, Victoria University of Wellington, NZ (2025–current)
    Marsden-funded project on temperate mesophotic sponge reefs; ecosystem modelling and conservation planning.
  • Data Analyst (Contractor), Department of Conservation, NZ (2024–2025)
    Marine reserves monitoring, data analysis, reporting, and statistical analyses.
  • PhD Researcher & Teaching Assistant, Victoria University of Wellington, NZ (2018–2024)
    Coral reef ecosystem modelling, project management, teaching, and collaboration.
  • North Pacific Fisheries Observer, NOAA Fisheries / Alaskan Observers, Inc., USA (2015–2018)
    Fisheries data collection, regulatory compliance, and liaison roles.
  • Husbandry Intern, Flying Sharks, Portugal (2014)
    Aquarium care, animal health, and live transport operations.

Technical Skills

  • R (Advanced), MATLAB (Intermediate), Python (Basic)
  • Data analysis, Data visualisation, LaTeX, Microsoft Office
  • PADI Rescue Diver, First Aid and Oxygen Administration, Full Driver's License, International travel (30+ countries)
